name: One-Pot Spaghetti With Cherry Tomatoes and Kale

products.name: washed, massaged, and roughly chopped kale

measurementUnit.name: pot
measurementUnit.description: as in, "one pot of boiling water"

steps.notes: Place spaghetti, tomatoes, lemon zest, oil, and kosher salt in a large, dry, shallow pan. (The pan should be large enough that the dry spaghetti can lie flat.)
Carefully add the boiling water to the pan with the spaghetti.

measurementUnit.name: pot
measurementUnit.description: as in, "one pot of boiling water"

steps.notes: Cover pan, and bring up to a boil.
Remove lid and simmer for about 6 minutes, using tongs to move the spaghetti around now and then so it doesn’t stick.
Add kale and continue cooking until remaining liquid has reduced to a sauce and the pasta is cooked through.

ingredients.name: washed, massaged, and roughly chopped kale

steps.notes: Taste, season with salt and pepper, and top with Parmesan.

products.name: added cooked ingredients and parmesan cheese
